social.quote: You never know till you try to reach them how accessible men are; but you must approach each man by the right door.
social.author: Henry Ward Beecher

social.quote: Silence is not always tact and it is tact that is golden, not silence.
social.author: Samuel Butler

social.quote: Some people mistake weakness for tact. If they are silent when they ought to speak and so feign an agreement they do not feel, they call it being tactful. Cowardice would be a much better name.
social.author: Frank Medlicott

social.quote: Talk to every woman as if you loved her, and to every man as if he bored you, and at the end of your first season you will have the reputation of possessing the most perfect social tact.
social.author: Oscar Wilde

social.quote: He spoke with a certain what-is-it in his voice, and I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled.
social.author: P. G. Wodehouse

social.quote: Tact is the intelligence of the heart.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: Be sure, when you think you are being extremely tactful, that you are not in reality running away from something you ought to face.
social.author: Sir Frank Medlicott

social.quote: In the battle of existence, Talent is the punch; Tact is the clever footwork.
social.author: Wilson Mizner

social.quote: I've learned never to ask a woman if she's pregnant.
social.author: Robert Watkins

social.quote: God has given each normal person a capacity to achieve some end. True, some are endowed with more talent than others, but God has left none of us talentless.
social.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

social.quote: I believe talent is like electricity. We do not understand electricity. We use it. Electricity makes no judgement. You can plug into it, and light up a lamp, keep a heart pump going ... or you can electrocute a person with it. ... I think talent is like that.
social.author: Maya Angelou

social.quote: At that point in life where your talent meets the needs of the world, that is where God wants you to be.
social.author: Albert Schweitzer

social.quote: Talent is like a faucet; while it is open, one must write. Inspiration is a farce that poets have invented to give themselves importance.
social.author: Jean Anouilh

social.quote: The handsome gifts that fate and nature lend us Most often are the very ones that end us.
social.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

social.quote: There is hardly anybody good for everything, and there is scarcely anybody who is absolutely good for nothing.
social.author: Lord Chesterfield

social.quote: Every form of talent involves a certain shameless-ness.
social.author: E. M. Cioran

social.quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
social.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

social.quote: A forte always makes a foible.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Nothing is so frequent as to mistake an ordinary human gift for a special and extraordinary endowment.
social.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

social.quote: When a man speaks of his strength, he whispers his weakness.
social.author: John M. Shanahan

social.quote: Never trust a man who speaks well of everybody.
social.author: John Churton Collins

social.quote: One should never trust a woman who tells one her real age. A woman who would tell one that, would tell one anything.
social.author: Oscar Wilde

social.quote: None but a coward dares to boast that he has never known fear.
social.author: Ferdinand Marshall Foch

social.quote: The louder he talked on his honor, the faster we counted our spoons.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Lovers never get tired of each other, because they are always talking about themselves.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: A bore is a man who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.
social.author: Gian Vincenzo Gravina

social.quote: He who praises everybody, praises nobody.
social.author: James Boswell

social.quote: You can take better care of your secret than another can.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: No one means all he says, and yet very few say all they mean, for words are slippery and thought is viscous.
social.author: Henry Adams

social.quote: The tale runs as it pleases the teller.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: What is so tedious as a twice-told tale?
social.author: Homer

social.quote: I cannot tell how the truth may be; I say the tale as 'twas said to me.
social.author: Sir Walter Scott

social.quote: An honest tale speeds best being plainly told.
social.author: William Shakespeare

social.quote: Suppose we had to pay taxes on what we think we're worth?
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: The state is never so efficient as when it wants money.
social.author: Anthony Burgess

social.quote: To tax and to please, no more than to love and be wise, is not given to men.
social.author: Edmund Burke

social.quote: There is one difference between a tax collector and a taxidermist-the taxidermist leaves the hide.
social.author: Mortimer Caplan

social.quote: The point to remember is that what the government gives it must first take away.
social.author: John S. Coleman

social.quote: Aside from sending someone to war or to prison, government s ability to make people involuntarily give over their money is its strongest exercise of authority over private citizens and their institutions.
social.author: William Greider

social.quote: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.
social.author: Andrew Jackson

social.quote: There is apparently nowhere a workable majority in the representative assemblies for making the specific cuts in expenditure which could bring down the taxes, and in election after election the people vote into power representatives who are as unable as they are unwilling to do anything about it.
social.author: Gunnar Myrdal

social.quote: Taxes, after all, are the dues that we pay for the privileges of membership in an organized society.
social.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

social.quote: It is the part of a good shepherd to shear his flock, not to flay it.
social.author: Tiberius

social.quote: All the difference in the world between the movies and the thrill I get out of a play at the theater. Ay, yes! Like fooling around with paper dolls when you could be playing with a real live baby.
social.author: Edna Ferber

social.quote: There is as much difference between the stage and the films as between a piano and a violin. Normally you can't become a virtuoso in both.
social.author: Ethel Barrymore

social.quote: Plays, gentlemen, are to their authors what children are to women: they cost more pain than they give pleasure.
social.author: Pierre de Beaumarchais

social.quote: Throughout the play everything possible was done to show the virtue, innocence and helplessness of the poor, and the abandoned cruelty, the heartless self-indulgence of the rich.
social.author: Joyce Cary

social.quote: Don't put your daughter on the stage, Mrs. Worthington, Don't put your daughter on the stage, The profession is overcrowdedAnd the struggle's pretty toughAnd admitting the fact She's burning to act, That isn't quite enough.
social.author: Noel Coward

social.quote: In London, theatregoers expect to laugh; in Paris, they wait grimly for proof that they should.
social.author: Robert Dhery

social.quote: A play should give you something to think about. When I see a play and understand it the first time, then I know it can't be much good.
social.author: T. S. Eliot

social.quote: Like hungry guests, a sitting audience looks: Plays are like suppers; poets are the cooks. The founders you: the table is this place: The carvers we: the prologue is the grace. Each act a course, each scene, a different dish.
social.author: George Farquhar

social.quote: In my plays I want to look at life-at the commonplace of existence-as if we had just turned a corner and run into it for the first time.
social.author: Christopher Fry

social.quote: The stage-play is a trial, not a deed of violence. The soul is opened, like the combination of a safe, by means of a word. You don't require an acetylene torch.
social.author: Jean Giraudoux

social.quote: The reward of energy, enterprise and thrift is taxes.
social.author: William Feather

social.quote: To tax and to please, no more than to love and to be wise, is not given to men.
social.author: Edmund Burke

social.quote: The avoidance of taxes is the only intellectual pursuit that still carries any reward.
social.author: John Maynard Keynes

social.quote: The art of taxation consists in so plucking the goose as to obtain the largest possible amount of feathers with the smallest possible amount of hissing.
social.author: Jean Baptiste Colbert

social.quote: Taxation without representation is tyranny.
social.author: James Otis

social.quote: Give me a task too big, too hard for human hands, then I shall come at length to lean on Thee, and leaning, find my strength.
social.author: W. H. Fowler

social.quote: Father, I beg of Thee a little task To dignify my days, 'tis all I ask.
social.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

social.quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish humble tasks as though they were great and noble. The world is moved along, not only by the mighty shoves of its heroes, but also by the aggregate of the tiny pushes of each honest worker.
social.author: Helen Keller

social.quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
social.author: Voltaire

social.quote: Please, Lord, teach us to laugh again; but, God, don't ever let us forget that we cried.
social.author: Bill Wilson

social.quote: It is such a secret place, the land of tears.
social.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

social.quote: Tears are just the soul on location.
social.author: Charlotte Mitchell

social.quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart don't know how to laugh either.
social.author: Golda Meir

social.quote: A hearty laugh gives one a dry cleaning, while a good cry is a wet wash.
social.author: Puzant Kevork Thomajan

social.quote: Women are never landlocked; they're always mere minutes away from the briny deep of tears.
social.author: Mignon McLaughlin

social.quote: The world's greatest water power is women's tears.
social.author: J. K. Morley

social.quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
social.author: John Vance Cheney

social.quote: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
social.author: Natalie Clifford Barnes

social.quote: Be careful how you live, you may be the only Bible some person ever reads.
social.author: W. J. Toms

social.quote: I have an implicit faith ... that mankind can only be saved through non-violence, which is the central teaching of the Bible, as I have understood the Bible.
social.author: Mahatma Gandhi

social.quote: When you are reading a book in a dark room, and come to a difficult part, you take it to a window to get more light. So take your Bibles to Christ.
social.author: Robert Murray McCheyne

social.quote: The central conception of Man in the Gospels is that he is an unfinished creation capable of reaching a higher level by a definite evolution which must begin by his own efforts.
social.author: Maurice Nicoll

social.quote: The lion and the calf shall lie down together but the calf won't get much sleep.
social.author: Woody Allen

social.quote: As in Paradise, God walks in the Holy Scriptures, seeking man.
social.author: Saint Ambrose

social.quote: A man is not educated who does not know the basic truths of the Bible.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: Other books were given for our information; the Bible was given for our transformation.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: Read thou; but first thyself prepare To read with zeal and mark with care ... And, when thou has read what here is writ, Let thy best practice second it. So twice each precept read shall be- First in the Book and next in thee.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: The Bible, as a revelation from God, was not designed to give us all the information we might desire, nor to solve all the questions about which the human soul is perplexed, but to impart enough to be a safe guide to the haven of eternal rest.
social.author: Albert Barnes

social.quote: In the theatre, people want to be surprised - but by things they expect.
social.author: Tristan Bernard

social.quote: In New York people don't go to the theatre - they go to see hits.
social.author: Louis Jourdan

social.quote: The New York audience, the night I went, gave the play a standing ovation. A cynical friend maintains that Broadway audiences always do this to justify to themselves the mountainous cost of the evening out.
social.author: William Goldman

social.quote: The theater is a gross art, built in sweeps and over-emphasis. Its second name is compromise.
social.author: Enid Bagnold

social.quote: You can tell how bad a musical is by how many times the chorus yells, 'Hooray.'
social.author: John Crosby

social.quote: If your job is to leaven ordinary lives with elevating spectacle, be elevating or be gone.
social.author: George F. Will

social.quote: My favorite stage performance is the show I'm in at the moment. It's like being in love - you can't remember being in love with anybody else.
social.author: Carol Channing

social.quote: I don't go to see sad plays. There are enough sad endings in life without buying a ticket to one.
social.author: Joe Rauh

social.quote: We should return to the Greeks, play in the open air: the drama dies of stalls and boxes and evening dress, and people who come to digest their dinner.
social.author: Eleonora Duse

social.quote: One begins with two people on a stage, and one of them had better say something pretty damn quick.
social.author: Moss Hart

social.quote: Those who are pleased with the fewest things know the least, as those who are pleased with everything know nothing.
social.author: William Hazlitt

social.quote: To taste the sea all one needs is one gulp.
social.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

social.quote: Different strokes for different folks.
social.author: Emlem Tunnell

social.quote: Every one carries his own inch-rule of taste, and amuses himself by applying it, triumphantly, wherever he travels.
social.author: Henry Adams

social.quote: Between friends differences in taste or opinion are irritating in direct proportion to their triviality.
social.author: W. H. Auden

social.quote: Taste is the fundamental quality which sums up all other qualities. It is the ne plus ultra of the intelligence.
social.author: Comte de Lautreamont

social.quote: The diffusion of taste is not the same thing as the improvement of taste.
social.author: William Hazlitt

social.quote: Taste speaks through a turn of phrase, a curl of the lip, a shrug of the shoulder: it makes an atmosphere.
social.author: Irving Howe

social.quote: One of the surest signs of the Philistine is his reverence for the superior tastes of those who put him down.
social.author: Pauline Kael

social.quote: Tastes in young people are changed by natural impetuosity, and in the aged are preserved by habit.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: The theologian who has no joy in his work is not a theologian at all. Sulky faces, morose thoughts and boring ways of speaking are intolerable in this science.
social.author: Karl Barth

social.quote: Doctrine is nothing but the skin of truth set up and stuffed.
social.author: Henry Ward Beecher

social.quote: First, I hate all theological controversy: it is wearing to the temper, and is I believe (at all events when viva voce) worse than useless.
social.author: Lewis Carroll

social.quote: The cure for false theology is motherwit. Forget your books and traditions, and obey your moral perceptions at this hour.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: The most tedious of all discourses are on the subject of the Supreme Being.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Hypotheses are only the pieces of scaffolding which are erected round a building during the course of construction, and which are taken away as soon as the edifice is completed.
social.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

social.quote: Theology is an attempt to explain a subject by men who do not understand it. The intent is not to tell the truth but to satisfy the questioner.
social.author: Elbert Hubbard

social.quote: Theology in religion is what poisons are in food.
social.author: Napoleon I

social.quote: Theology emerged not as a course of knowledge but as a feast of homily and imagination and exaggeration in which every man could find his image and his portion. And yet there were limits.
social.author: Israel Shenker

social.quote: Theological religion is the source of all imaginable follies and disturbances; it is the parent of fanaticism and civil discord; it is the enemy of mankind.
social.author: Voltaire

social.quote: There is no harbor of peace From the changing waves of joy and despair.
social.author: Euripides

social.quote: Temperament, like liberty, is important despite how many crimes are committed in its name.
social.author: Louis Kronenbergerer

social.quote: The tranquility or agitation of our temper does not depend so much on the big things which happen to us in life, as on the pleasant or unpleasant arrangements of the little things which happen daily.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: The happiness and unhappiness of men depend as much on their turn of mind as on fortune.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: A human being tends to believe that the mood of the moment, be it troubled or blithe, peaceful or stormy, is the true, native, and permanent tenor of his existence ... whereas the truth is that he is condemned to improvisation and morally lives from hand to mouth all the time.
social.author: Thomas Mann

social.quote: If health and a fair day smile upon me, I am a very good fellow; if a corn trouble my toe, I am sullen, out of humor, and inaccessible.
social.author: Michel de Montaigne

social.quote: Certainly there are good and bad times, but our mood changes more often than our fortune.
social.author: Jules Renard

social.quote: Testimony is showing your scars and telling how Jesus healed you.
social.author: Warren Walden

social.quote: Teaching should be such that what is offered is perceived as a valuable gift and not as a hard duty.
social.author: Albert Einstein

social.quote: A man should first direct himself in the way he should go. Only then should he instruct others.
social.author: Buddha

social.quote: Never try to teach a pig to sing... it wastes your time and annoys the pig.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: We shouldn't teach great books; we should teach a love of reading.
social.author: B. F. Skinner

social.quote: I cut the tree and my calloused hand carves it, but someone more able than I must finish it with beauty and brilliance.
social.author: Rafael Cordero y Molina

social.quote: Just as a person is commanded to honor and revere his father, so he is under an obligation to honor and revere his teacher, even to a greater extent than his father; for his father gave him life in this world, while his teacher instructs him in wisdom, secures for him life in the world to come.
social.author: Maimonides

social.quote: You'll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.
social.author: Dr. Seuss

social.quote: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
social.author: John Wooden

social.quote: A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
social.author: Henry Adams

social.quote: We teach more by what we are than by what we teach.
social.author: Will Durant

social.quote: The terrorist and the policeman both come from the same basket.
social.author: Joseph Conrad

social.quote: Everybody's worried about stopping terrorism. Well, there's a really easy way: stop participating in it.
social.author: Noam Chomsky

social.quote: Terrorism is the tactic of demanding the impossible, and demanding it at gunpoint.
social.author: Christopher Hitchens

social.quote: Terror depends on who's wearing the hood.
social.author: Roger Woodis

social.quote: If we like them, they're freedom fighters, she thought. If we don't like them, they're terrorists. In the unlikely case we can't make up our minds, they're temporarily only guerrillas.
social.author: Carl Sagan

social.quote: The truth is that there is no terror untempered by some great moral idea.
social.author: Jean-Luc Godard

social.quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.
social.author: Mae West

social.quote: I can resist everything except temptation.
social.author: Oscar Wilde

social.quote: The biggest human temptation is to settle for too little.
social.author: Thomas Merton

social.quote: Sometimes the devil tempts me to believe in God.
social.author: Stanislaw J. Lec

social.quote: Opportunity may knock only once, but temptation leans on the doorbell.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: I find I always have to write something on a steamed-up mirror.
social.author: Elaine Dundy

social.quote: All men are tempted. There is no man that lives that can't be broken down, provided it is the right temptation, put in the right spot.
social.author: Henry Ward Beecher

social.quote: No temptation can ever be measured by the value of its object.
social.author: Colette

social.quote: There is a certain degree of temptation which will overcome any virtue. Now, in so far as you approach temptation to a man, you do him an injury; and, if he is overcome, you share his guilt.
social.author: Samuel Johnson

social.quote: Who will not judge him worthy to be robbed That sets his doors wide open to a thief, And shows the felon where his treasure lies?
social.author: Ben Jonson

social.quote: I owe a lot to my teachers and mean to pay them back some day.
social.author: Stephen Leacock

social.quote: A very wise old teacher once said: 'I consider a day's teaching is wasted if we do not all have one hearty laugh.' He meant that when people laugh together, they cease to be young and old, master and pupils, workers and driver, jailer and prisoners, they become a single group of human beings enjoying its existence.
social.author: Gilbert Highet

social.quote: Life is amazing, and the teacher had better prepare himself to be a medium for that amazement.
social.author: Edward Blishen

social.quote: A teacher should have an atmosphere of awe, and walk wonderingly, as if he was amazed at being himself.
social.author: Walter Bagehot

social.quote: The reason teaching has to go on is that children are not born human; they are made so.
social.author: Jacques Barzun

social.quote: I am not a teacher, I am an awakener.
social.author: Robert Frost

social.quote: The secret of teaching is to appear to have known all your life what you learned only yesterday.
social.author: John Burns

social.quote: To teach is to learn twice.
social.author: Joseph Joubert

social.quote: One might as well say he has sold when no one has bought as to say he has taught when no one has learned.
social.author: John Dewey

social.quote: One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feeling. Curriculum is necessary raw material, but warmth is the vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.
social.author: Carl Jung

social.quote: Humanity is acquiring the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
social.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

social.quote: Those who live by electronics die by electronics. Sic semper tyrannis.
social.author: Kurt Vonnegut

social.quote: The computer is down. I hope it's something serious.
social.author: Stanton Delaplane

social.quote: Technology presumes there's just one right way to do things and there never is.
social.author: Robert M. Pirsig

social.quote: Technology is the knack of so organizing the world that we don't have to experience it.
social.author: Max Frisch

social.quote: The danger always exists that our technology will serve as a buffer between us and nature, a block between us and the deeper dimensions of our own experience.
social.author: Rollo May

social.quote: The shock of twentieth-century technology numbed our brains and we are just beginning to notice the spiritual and social debris that our technology has strewn about us.
social.author: Neil Postman

social.quote: If there is technological advance without social advance, there is, almost automatically, an increase in human misery.
social.author: Michael Harrington

social.quote: I have never received a telephone call that justified the excitement and fuss of the electronics involved. If I can't see somebody I love, for instance, such as a daughter, or a son, I would rather receive a letter.
social.author: William Saroyan

social.quote: More and more I come to value charity and love of one's fellow beings above everything else ... All our lauded technological progress - our very civilization - is like the axe in the hand of the pathological criminal.
social.author: Albert Einstein

social.quote: If you can't be thankful for what you receive, be thankful for what you escape.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: Look up on high, and thank the God of all.
social.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

social.quote: I thank You God for most this amazing day: for the leaping greenly spirits of trees and a blue true dream of sky; and for everythingwhich is natural which is infinite which is yes ...
social.author: E. E. Cummings

social.quote: And let us give thanks for Someone to thank.
social.author: Gerhard E. Frost

social.quote: Thank God when he oppresses you, and again when he releases you.
social.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

social.quote: When any calamity has been suffered the first thing to be remembered is how much has been escaped.
social.author: Samuel Johnson

social.quote: Let never day nor night unhallow'd pass, But still remember what the Lord hath done.
social.author: William Shakespeare

social.quote: It has seemed to me fit and proper that the gifts of God should be solemnly, reverently, and gratefully acknowledged with one heart and one voice by the whole American people. I do, therefore, invite my fellow citizens ... to set apart and observe the last Thursday of November next as a day of thanksgiving and praise to our beneficent Father who dwelleth in the heavens.
social.author: Abraham Lincoln

social.quote: Nothing is really real unless it happens on television.
social.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

social.quote: Television is an invention that permits you to be entertained in your living room by people you wouldn't have in your home.
social.author: David Frost

social.quote: Television deprives children of their imaginations.
social.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

social.quote: The medium is the message.
social.author: Marshall McLuhan

social.quote: It is television's primary damage that it provides ten million children with the same fantasy, ready-made and on a platter.
social.author: Marya Mannes

social.quote: I don't know how long a child will remain utterly static in front of the television, but my guess is that it could be well into their thirties.
social.author: A. A. Gill

social.quote: Whether or not you love television, you've got to admit that it certainly loves itself.
social.author: Mignon McLaughlin

social.quote: Dealing with network executives is like being nibbled to death by ducks.
social.author: Eric Sevaraid

social.quote: The primary danger of the television screen lies not so much in the behavior it produces as the behavior it prevents-the talks, the games, the family activities and the arguments through which much of the child's learning takes place and his character is formed.
social.author: Urie Bronfenbrenner

social.quote: Today's audience knows more about what's on television than what's in life.
social.author: Larry Gelbart

social.quote: Claustrophobia? It's a dreadful fear of Santa Claus.
social.author: Vinnie Barbarino

social.quote: The volume of paper expands to fill the available briefcases.
social.author: Jerry Brown

social.quote: People who stare each other in the eye for sixty seconds straight will soon either be fighting or making love.
social.author: Peter Butler

social.quote: If you have to learn it from a self-help book, you may be beyond help.
social.author: Wes Smith

social.quote: Soderquist's Paradox: There are more horses' asses than horses.
social.author: John Peer

social.quote: The roe is reputed to sleep for a thousand years and then suddenly rise in flames, particularly if it was smoking when it dozed off.
social.author: Woody Allen

social.quote: As we say in the sewer, time and tide wait for no man.
social.author: Ed Norton

social.quote: A psychotic thinks that 2 plus 2 makes 5. A neurotic KNOWS that 2 plus 2 makes 4 - he just can't stand it.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: McGinn's Law: Just about everything takes longer than they say it does, except sex.
social.author: Jim McGinn

social.quote: The human brain starts working the moment you are born and never stops until you stand up to speak in public.
social.author: George Jessel

social.quote: Electric communication will never be a substitute for the face of someone who with their soul encourages another person to be brave and true.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: Many are called but few are called back.
social.author: Mary Tricky

social.quote: The telephone is the greatest nuisance among conveniences, the greatest convenience among nuisances.
social.author: Norman Douglas

social.quote: She had to have a telephone. There was no one to whom she wanted to talk but she had to have a telephone.
social.author: Joan Didion

social.quote: The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.
social.author: J. B. Priestley

social.quote: I don't answer the phone. I get the feeling whenever I do that there will be someone on the other end.
social.author: Fred Couples

social.quote: There are huge creative advantages in having huge chunks of time when no one can find you. Emails and phones have diluted the experience of travel.
social.author: Pete McCarthy

social.quote: Today the telephone takes precedence over everything. It reaches a point of terrorism, particularly at dinnertime.
social.author: Niels Diffrient

social.quote: The real motive behind the popularity of cell phones is not convenience, but a base desire to be self-important. Cell-phone babblers are never really able to be present 'in the moment', since they are constantly trying to impress an audience with the implication that behind these mysterious phone calls very important things are taking place.
social.author: Natalie Silvers

social.quote: In heaven, when the blessed use the telephone they will say what they have to say and not a word besides.
social.author: W. Somerset Maugham

social.quote: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human natur.
social.author: Charles Dickens

social.quote: Sobriety is love of health, or inability to eat much.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: Intemperate temperance injures the cause of temperance, while temperate temperance helps it in its fight against intemperate intemperance.
social.author: Mark Twain

social.quote: Abstinence is easier than temperance.
social.author: Seneca

social.quote: Even though it's a time of testing for us, it's a time of glorifying Him in a way that the smooth places in our lives could never do.
social.author: Sandy Edmonson

social.quote: It may be difficult to understand why a test comes our way, but we must never forget that the test is accomplishing refining and purification.
social.author: Billy Graham

social.quote: God does not offer us a way out of the testings of life. He offers us a way through, and that makes all the difference.
social.author: W. T. Purkiser

social.quote: No theory is good except on condition that one use it to go beyond.
social.author: Andre Gide

social.quote: Your theory is crazy, but it's not crazy enough to be true.
social.author: Niels Bohr

social.quote: Professors in every branch of the sciences prefer their own theories to truth; the reason is that their theories are private property, but truth is common stock.
social.author: Charles Caleb Colton

social.quote: It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data.
social.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

social.quote: The astonishment of life is the absence of any appearances of reconciliation between the theory and the practice of life.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: In theory, there is nothing to hinder our following what we are taught, but in life there are many things to draw us aside.
social.author: Epictetus

social.quote: To be sure, theory is useful. But without warmth of heart and without love it bruises the very ones it claims to save.
social.author: Andre Gide

social.quote: All theory, my friend, is grey, But green is life's glad golden tree.
social.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

social.quote: It is so much easier to talk of poverty than to think of the poor, to argue the rights of capital than to see its results. Pretty soon we come to think of the theories and abstract ideas as things in themselves.
social.author: Walter Lippmann

social.quote: For every fact there is an infinity of hypotheses. The more you look the more you see.
social.author: Robert M. Pirsig

social.quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
social.author: Tennessee Williams

social.quote: Time was invented so everything wouldn't happen at once.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.
social.author: T. S. Eliot

social.quote: Time goes, you say? Ah no! Alas, Time stays, we go.
social.author: Henry Austin Dobson

social.quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
social.author: Rabindranath Tagore

social.quote: Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in.
social.author: Henry David Thoreau

social.quote: Time was rushing around me like water around a big wet rock. The only difference is, I was not so durable as stones. Very quickly I would be smoothed away.
social.author: Louise Erdrich

social.quote: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
social.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

social.quote: As the herdsman drives cattle by the rod to the pen, so does time drive man to death.
social.author: Dhammapada

social.quote: Dost thou love life, then do not squander time, for that's the stuff life is made of.
social.author: Benjamin Franklin

social.quote: A bluff taken seriously is more useful than a serious threat interpreted as a bluff.
social.author: Henry Kissinger

social.quote: The rattling thunderbolt hath but his clap, the lightning but his flash, and as they both come in a moment, so do they both end in a minute.
social.author: John Lyly

social.quote: Words of comfort, skillfully administered, are the oldest therapy known to man.
social.author: Louis Nizer

social.quote: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
social.author: Hubert Humphrey

social.quote: There is no better therapy than understanding.
social.author: Jim Piersall

social.quote: The personality of the therapist is the most important human element in the therapeutic process.
social.author: Thomas Tyndall

social.quote: Women do not fancy timid men.
social.author: Madame Deluzy

social.quote: There is that destroyeth his own soul through bashfulness.
social.author: Apocrypha

social.quote: Shyness has a strange element of narcissism, a belief that how we look, how we perform, is truly important to other people.
social.author: Andre Dubus

social.quote: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: There are men whose language is strong and defying enough, yet their eyes and their actions ask leave of other men to live.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: He suddenly became shy and developed a conceited grin-the grin of the village yokel whose cricket score is mentioned before a stranger.
social.author: E. M. Forster

social.quote: He will never have true friends who is afraid of making enemies.
social.author: William Hazlitt

social.quote: Happiness hates the timid! So does Science!
social.author: Eugene O'Neill

social.quote: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
social.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

social.quote: Remember the old saying, "Faint heart ne'er won fair lady."
social.author: Miguel de Cervantes

social.quote: Timeliness is best in all matters.
social.author: Hesiod

social.quote: To each thing belongs it's measure. Occasion is best to know.
social.author: Pindar

social.quote: If you trap the moment before it's ripe, The tears of repentence you'll certainly wipe; But if once you let the ripe moment go You can never wipe off the tears of woe.
social.author: William Blake

social.quote: There are times when sense may be unseasonable, as well as truth.
social.author: William Congreve

social.quote: How many things by season seasoned are To their right praise and true perfection!
social.author: William Shakespeare

social.quote: In season, all is good.
social.author: Sophocles

social.quote: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
social.author: Dr. Seuss

social.quote: The creditor hath a better memory than the debtor.
social.author: James Howell

social.quote: Never explain. Your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe it anyway.
social.author: Elbert Hubbard

social.quote: Fear leads you directly into the path of that which you fear.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: We probably wouldn't worry about what people think of us if we could know how seldom they do.
social.author: Olin Miller

social.quote: What people say behind your back is your standing in the community.
social.author: Edgar Watson Howe

social.quote: The thorns which I have reaped are of the tree I planted.
social.author: Lord Byron

social.quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
social.author: Erica Jong

social.quote: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
social.author: Margaret Mead

social.quote: There is no little enemy.
social.author: Benjamin Franklin

social.quote: Today is the first day of the rest of our life.
social.author: Charles Dederich

social.quote: Happy the man, and happy he alone, He who can call to-day his own; He who, secure within, can say, Tomorrow do thy worst, for I have lived to-day.
social.author: John Dryden

social.quote: Tomorrow never comes.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
social.author: Norman Vincent Peale

social.quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought; it is founded on our thoughts and made up of our thoughts. If a man speak or act with an evil thought, suffering follows him as a wheel follows the hoof of the beast that draws the cart.
social.author: Dhammapada

social.quote: Be careful of your thoughts-they may break into words at any time.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: We do not at present educate people to think but, rather, to have opinions, and that is something altogether different.
social.author: Louis L'Amour

social.quote: What we think, we become.
social.author: Buddha

social.quote: Great thoughts come from the heart.
social.author: Vauvenargues

social.quote: Life consists in what a man is thinking all day.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Your life is what your thoughts make it.
social.author: Marcus Aurelius

social.quote: No fathers or mothers think their own children ugly; and this self-deceit is yet stronger with respect to the offspring of the mind.
social.author: Miguel de Cervantes

social.quote: Great men are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force, that thought rules the world.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Old boys have their playthings as well as young ones; the difference is only in price.
social.author: Benjamin Franklin

social.quote: War toys are not just noise and games that little boys play.
social.author: Jeanne-Marie Houston

social.quote: Perhaps the five-pound note I slipped into his hand was excessive, but, lacking a diamond the size of the Cullinan, I had no adequate means of expressing my gratitude.
social.author: S. J. Perelman

social.quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
social.author: William James

social.quote: If everybody thought before they spoke, the silence would be deafening.
social.author: Gerald Barzen

social.quote: If you make people think they're thinking they'll love you: but if you really make them think, they'll hate you.
social.author: Don Marquis

social.quote: It's much easier to do and die than it is to reason why.
social.author: G. A. Studdert-Kennedy

social.quote: Many highly intelligent people are poor thinkers. Many people of average intelligence are skilled thinkers. The power of a car is separate from the way the car is driven.
social.author: Edward de Bono

social.quote: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.
social.author: Thomas Szasz

social.quote: To think is to differ.
social.author: Clarence Darrow

social.quote: Men fear thought as they fear nothing else on earth - more than ruin, more even than death.
social.author: Bertrand Russell

social.quote: The trouble is that thinking looks like loafing. Who wants to pay people for daydreaming?
social.author: W. Somerset Maugham

social.quote: Thinking is harder work than hard work.
social.author: Leo Rosten

social.quote: I am moneys medium. It passes through me- taxes, insurance, mortgage, child support, rent, legal fees. All this dignified blundering costs plenty.
social.author: Saul Bellow

social.quote: A man often pays dear for a small frugality.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: I have noticed that it is the easy-going ones among us who have the best time; in this climate, at the rate a stove eats wood, if a man were to grow too thrifty or forehanded he'd never be able to crawl out from under his woodpile.
social.author: E. B. White

social.quote: Men are divided between those who are as thrifty as if they would live forever, and those who are as extravagant as if they were going to die the next day.
social.author: Aristotle

social.quote: A penny saved is a penny to squander.
social.author: Ambrose Bierce

social.quote: Economy is a distributive virtue, and consists not in saving but in selection.
social.author: Edmund Burke

social.quote: Expense, and great expense, may be an essential part of true economy.
social.author: Edmund Burke

social.quote: Men do not realize how great an income thrift is.
social.author: Cicero

social.quote: Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure nineteen nineteen six, result happiness. Annualincome twenty pounds, annual expenditure twenty pounds ought and six, result misery.
social.author: Charles Dickens

social.quote: Economy, in the estimation of common minds, often means the absence of all taste and comfort.
social.author: Sydney Smith

social.quote: Spiritual language is no substitute for spiritual maturity.
social.author: Ron Parrish

social.quote: There is validity in talking in tongues, but it's not a criteria for spirituality.
social.author: Ron Parrish

social.quote: Something there is that doesn't love a wall, That wants it down.
social.author: Robert Frost

social.quote: We go right enough, darling, if we go wrong together!
social.author: George Santayana

social.quote: Togetherness is a substitute sense of community, a counterfeit communion.
social.author: Gabriel Vahanian

social.quote: It belongs among the refinements of totalitarian government in our century that they don't permit their opponents to die a great, dramatic martyr's death for their convictions.
social.author: Hannah Arendt

social.quote: I suspect that in our loathing of totalitarianism, there is infused a good deal of admiration for its efficiency.
social.author: T. S. Eliot

social.quote: I have read somewhere that in a totalitarian system martyrdom does better than thought.
social.author: Vaclav Havel

social.quote: Totalitarianism spells simplification: an enormous reduction in the variety of aims, motives, interests, human types, and, above all, in the categories and units of power.
social.author: Eric Hoffer

social.quote: You have not converted a man because you have silenced him.
social.author: John Morley

social.quote: The implements to him who can handle them.
social.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

social.quote: A workman who wants to do his work well must first prepare his tools.
social.author: Confucius

social.quote: A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
social.author: George Herbert

social.quote: In this world a man must either be anvil or hammer.
social.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

social.quote: If the only tool you have is a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
social.author: Abraham Maslow

social.quote: Finding the tool is often half the battle.
social.author: Andrew A. Rooney

social.quote: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.
social.author: Albert Schweitzer

social.quote: Tragedy, no matter how sad, becomes boring to those not caught in its addictive caress.
social.author: Maya Angelou

social.quote: A tragedy means always a mans struggle with that which is stronger than man.
social.author: G. K. Chesterton

social.quote: Why is it that man desires to be made sad, beholding doleful and tragical things, which yet himself would by no means suffer?
social.author: St. Augustine

social.quote: Only a great mind overthrown yields tragedy.
social.author: Jacques Barzun

social.quote: One cannot balance tragedy in the scales Unless one weighs it with the tragic heart.
social.author: Stephen Vincent Benet

social.quote: I suspect tragedy in the American countryside because all the people capable of it move to the big towns at twenty.
social.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

social.quote: Tragedy and comedy are simply questions of value; a little misfit in life makes us laugh; a great one is tragedy and cause for expression of grief.
social.author: Elbert Hubbard

social.quote: A tragic writer does not have to believe in God, but he must believe in man.
social.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

social.quote: Ours is essentially a tragic age, so we refuse to take it tragically.
social.author: D. H. Lawrence

social.quote: Traffic signals in New York are just rough guidelines.
social.author: David Letterman

social.quote: There is no creation without tradition. No one creates from nothing.
social.author: Carlos Fuentes

social.quote: It is pure illusion to think that an opinion which passes down from century to century, from generation to generation, may not be entirely false.
social.author: Pierre Bayle

social.quote: We must accept all the implications of our human inheritance, one of the most important of which is the small scope of biologically transmitted behavior, and the enormous role of the cultural process of the transmission of tradition.
social.author: Ruth Benedict

social.quote: The dead govern the living.
social.author: Auguste Comte

social.quote: I am the East. I have philosophies, I have religions, who would exchange them for airplanes?
social.author: Ameen Rihani

social.quote: They that reverence too much old times are but a scorn to the new.
social.author: Francis Bacon

social.quote: Hardened round us, encasing wholly every notion we form, is a wrappage of traditions, hearsays, mere words.
social.author: Thomas Carlyle

social.quote: A love for tradition has never weakened a nation, indeed it has strengthened nations in their hour of peril; but the new view must come, the world must roll forward.
social.author: Winston Churchill

social.quote: Tradition, thou art for suckling children, Thou art the enlivening milk for babes, But no meat for men is in thee.
social.author: Stephen Crane

social.quote: The highest result of education is tolerance.
social.author: Helen Keller

social.quote: If you will please people, you must please them in their own way; and as you cannot make them what they should be, you must take them as they are.
social.author: Lord Chesterfield

social.quote: We are all tolerant enough of those who do not agree with us, provided only they are sufficiently miserable.
social.author: David Grayson

social.quote: The golden rule of conduct ... is mutual toleration, seeing that we will never all think alike and we shall always see Truth in fragment and from different angles of vision.
social.author: Mahatma Gandhi

social.quote: The peak of tolerance is most readily achieved by those who are not burdened with convictions.
social.author: Alexander Chase

social.quote: Persecution was at least a sign of personal interest. Tolerance is composed of nine parts of apathy to one of brotherly love.
social.author: Frank Moore Colby

social.quote: True goodness is not without that germ of greatness that can bear with patience the mistakes of the ignorant.
social.author: Charles Caleb Colton

social.quote: Racist, sexist, and homophobic thoughts cannot, alas, be abolished by fiat but only by the time-honored methods of persuasion, education and exposure to the other guy's-or excuse me, woman's-point of view.
social.author: Barbara Ehrenreich

social.quote: Laws alone cannot secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be a spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
social.author: Albert Einstein

social.quote: Tolerance is just a makeshift, suitable for an overcrowded and overheated planet. It carries on when love gives out, and love generally gives out as soon as we move away from our home and our friends.
social.author: E. M. Forster

social.quote: To the average cigarette smoker the world is his ashtray.
social.author: Alexander Chase

social.quote: Smokers, male and female, inject and excuse idleness in their lives every time they light a cigarette.
social.author: Colette

social.quote: A man of no conversation should smoke.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: The believing we do something when we do nothing is the first illusion of tobacco.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: A custom [smoking] loathsome to the eye, harmful to the brain, dangerous to the lungs, and in the black stinking fume thereof, nearest resembling the horrible Stygian smoke of the pit that is bottomless.
social.author: James I of England

social.quote: A woman is only a woman, but a good cigar is a smoke.
social.author: Rudyard Kipling

social.quote: It is now proved beyond doubt that smoking is one of the leading causes of statistics.
social.author: John Philip Fletcher Knebel

social.quote: For thy sake, tobacco, I Would do anything but die.
social.author: Charles Lamb

social.quote: This very night I am going to leave off tobacco! Surely there must be some other world in which this unconquerable purpose shall be realized.
social.author: Charles Lamb

social.quote: He stopped smoking at least once a month. He went through with it like the solid citizen he was: admitted the evils of tobacco, courageously made resolves, laid out plans to check the vice, tapered off his allowance of cigars, and expounded the pleasures of virtuousness to every one he met. He did everything, in fact, except stop smoking.
social.author: Sinclair Lewis

social.quote: A smith becomes a smith by working at the forge.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: He is a poor smith who cannot bear smoke.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: When it comes to getting things done, we need fewer architects and more brick layers.
social.author: Colleen C. Barrett

social.quote: Each honest calling, each walk of life, has its own elite, its own aristocracy based upon excellence of performance.
social.author: James Bryant Conant

social.quote: He that hath a trade hath an estate.
social.author: Benjamin Franklin

social.quote: Love the little trade which thou hast learned, and be content therewith.
social.author: Marcus Aurelius

social.quote: The blow of a whip raises a welt, but a blow of the tongue crushes bones.
social.author: Apocrypha

social.quote: Many have fallen by the edge of the sword: but not so many as have fallen by the tongue.
social.author: Apocrypha

social.quote: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
social.author: Miguel de Cervantes

social.quote: Out of some little thing, too free a tongue Can make an outrageous wrangle.
social.author: Euripides

social.quote: A sharp tongue cuts itself.
social.author: Alan Harris

social.quote: Never trust your tongue when your heart is bitter.
social.author: Samuel J. Hurwitt

social.quote: A sharp tongue is the only edge-tool that grows keener with constant use.
social.author: Washington Irving

social.quote: It's all to do with the training: you can do a lot if you're properly trained.
social.author: Queen Elizabeth II

social.quote: The fear of hell, the punishment of sin, how the modern parent revolts from such teaching. Yet I will assert that far from doing us children harm, it was a sure foundation to the world of our confidence, a master girder in our palace of delight.
social.author: Joyce Cary

social.quote: Art is long, life short; judgment difficult, opportunity transient.
social.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

social.quote: Life is short and the art long.
social.author: Hippocrates

social.quote: It is no hard matter to get children; but after they are born, then begins the trouble, solicitude, and care rightly to train, principle, and bring them up.
social.author: Michel de Montaigne

social.quote: Man is the only one that knows nothing, that can learn nothing without being taught. He can neither speak nor walk nor eat, and in short he can do nothing at the prompting of nature only, but weep.
social.author: Pliny the Elder

social.quote: Tis education forms the common mind, Just as the twig is bent the tree's inclined.
social.author: Alexander Pope

social.quote: Children should be led into the right paths, not by severity, but by persuasion.
social.author: Terence

social.quote: A man can seldom-very, very, seldom-fight a winning fight against his training: the odds are too heavy.
social.author: Mark Twain

social.quote: When you find the person you want to spend the rest of your life with, you want the rest of your life to begin as soon as possible.
social.author: Billy Crystal

social.quote: The trick is to be there when it's settled.
social.author: Arthur Goldberg

social.quote: What a gigantic step it is not to move.
social.author: Merrit Malloy

social.quote: Hurry? I have no time to hurry.
social.author: Igor Stravinsky

social.quote: You mean they've scheduled Yom Kippur opposite "Charlie's Angels"?
social.author: Fred Silverman

social.quote: You shouldn't blow the chance when you've got the chance to say ... "I love you ... I honestly love you."
social.author: Peter Allen

social.quote: You have to think about one shot. One shot is what it's all about. The deer has to be taken with one shot. I try to tell people that - they don't listen.
social.author: Robert DeNiro

social.quote: Don't wait for your "ship to come in," and feel angry and cheated when it doesn't. Get going with something small.
social.author: Dr. Irene Kassorla

social.quote: If it's going to come out eventually, better it come out immediately.
social.author: Henry Kissinger

social.quote: The word "now" is like a bomb through the window, and it ticks.
social.author: Arthur Miller

social.quote: Back of tranquility lies always conquered unhappiness.
social.author: David Grayson

social.quote: Calm's not life's crown, though calm is well.
social.author: Matthew Arnold

social.quote: There's nought, no doubt, so much the spirit calms As rum and true religion.
social.author: Lord Byron

social.quote: Tranquillity! thou better name Than all the family of Fame.
social.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

social.quote: No one can achieve Serenity until the glare of passion is past the meridian.
social.author: Cyril Connolly

social.quote: When we are unable to find tranquility within ourselves, it is useless to seek it elsewhere.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: The world is fleeting; all things pass away; Or is it we that pass and they that stay?
social.author: Lucian

social.quote: We are used to the actions of human beings, not to their stillness.
social.author: V. S. Pritchett

social.quote: There is no joy but calm.
social.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

social.quote: If you want inner peace find it in solitude, not speed, and if you would find yourself, look to the land from which you came and to which you go.
social.author: Stewart L. Udall

social.quote: Since sorrow follows joy As autumn does the spring Man must transcend the joys Of earth, which sorrows bring.
social.author: Mirza Ghalib

social.quote: It has been preached in every country, taught everywhere, but only believed in by a few, because until we get the experience ourselves, we cannot believe in it.
social.author: Vivekananda

social.quote: ... unless you made your life a turning point, there was no reason for existing.
social.author: Saul Bellow

social.quote: Many a truth is spoke in jest.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: It is hard to believe that a man is telling the truth when you know that you would lie if you were in his place.
social.author: Henry Louis Mencken

social.quote: All charming people have something to conceal, usually their total dependence on the appreciation of others.
social.author: Cyril Connolly

social.quote: The height of cleverness is to be able to conceal it.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: Success has always been a great liar.
social.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

social.quote: It is impossible for a man to be cheated by anyone but himself.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Truth is a torch that gleams through the fog without dispelling it.
social.author: Claude-Adrien Helvetius

social.quote: Crafty men deal in generalizations.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: There are times when lying is the most sacred of duties.
social.author: Eugene Marin Labiche

social.quote: The cruelest lies are often told in silence.
social.author: Adlai Stevenson

social.quote: The idol of yesterday is the demon of today ruthlessly trodden in the dust.
social.author: Surendranath Banerjea

social.quote: Worlds on worlds are rolling ever From creation to decay, Like the bubbles on a river Sparkling, bursting, borne away.
social.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

social.quote: Must the poetry of everything vanish Or can my life ever condense it?
social.author: Pablo Neruda

social.quote: Nothing lives long Only the earth and the mountains.
social.author: White Antelope

social.quote: The entire most beautiful order of things that are very good, when their measures have been accomplished, is to pass away.
social.author: St. Augustine

social.quote: All is ephemeral,-fame and the famous as well.
social.author: Marcus Aurelius

social.quote: Loveliest of lovely things are they, On earth, that soonest pass away
social.author: William Cullen Bryant

social.quote: Ambition is a meteor-gleam; Fame a restless airy dream; Pleasures, insects on the wing Round Peace, th' tend rest flow'r of spring.
social.author: Robert Burns

social.quote: Everything in life is somewhere else and you get there in a car.
social.author: E. B. White

social.quote: The stop sign reminds us to slow our pace, take a moment's rest, and look around. Therein lies a whole philosophy of life.
social.author: Philip Toshio Sudo

social.quote: I was hitchhiking the other day and a hearse stopped. I said, 'No thanks, I'm not going that far.'
social.author: Steven Wright

social.quote: The one thing that unites all human beings, regardless of age, gender, religion, economic status or ethnic background, is that, deep down inside, we all believe that we are above-average drivers.
social.author: Dave Barry

social.quote: Our motor car is our supreme form of privacy when we are away from home.
social.author: Marshall McLuhan

social.quote: Is fuel efficiency really what we need most desperately? I say what we really need is a car that can be shot when it breaks down.
social.author: Russell Baker

social.quote: My aunt, thirty years a feminist, says, 'A car is just an extension of your penis.' Oh, I wish.
social.author: Tim Allen

social.quote: If you elect me the first Jewish justice of the peace, I'll reduce the speed limit to 54.95.
social.author: Kinky Friedman

social.quote: In the Third World, honk your horn only under the following circumstances: 1. When anything blocks the road. 2. When anything doesn't. 3. When anything might. 4. At red lights. 5. At green lights. 6. At all other times.
social.author: P. J. O'Rourke

social.quote: I know that experts say you're more likely to get hurt crossing the street than you are flying, but that doesn't make me any less frightened of flying. If anything, it makes me more afraid of crossing the street.
social.author: Ellen DeGeneres

social.quote: An idea does not pass from one language to another without change.
social.author: Miguel de Unamuno

social.quote: Interpreter, n. One who enables two persons of different languages to understand each other by repeating to each what it would have been to the interpreter's advantage for the other to have said.
social.author: Ambrose Bierce

social.quote: Translation from one language to another is like viewing a piece of tapestry on the wrong side where though the figures are distinguishable yet there are so many ends and threads that the beauty and exactness of the work is obscured.
social.author: Miguel de Cervantes

social.quote: As a true translator you will take care not to translate word for word.
social.author: Horace

social.quote: Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all peoples cry, laugh, eat, worry, and die, it can introduce the idea that if we try to understand each other, we may even become friends.
social.author: Maya Angelou

social.quote: Short cuts make long delays.
social.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

social.quote: You cannot travel on the path before you have become the Path itself.
social.author: Buddha

social.quote: There was this to be said about the journey: It made one fully conscious of the terrestrial distance that separated the hot city from the leafy and ingenuous streets of the junction village.
social.author: John Cheever

social.quote: Why do the wrong people travel, travel, travel, When the right people stay back home?
social.author: Noel Coward

social.quote: Each traveler should know what he has to see, and what properly belongs to him, on a journey.
social.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

social.quote: To live is to see, and traveling sometimes speeds up the process.
social.author: Edward Hoagland

social.quote: Nothing is so awesomely unfamiliar as the familiar that discloses itself at the end of a journey. Nothing shakes the heart so much as meeting-far, far away-what you last met at home.
social.author: Cynthia Ozick

social.quote: There is a peculiar pleasure in riding out into the unknown. A pleasure which no second journey on the same trail ever affords.
social.author: Edith Durham

social.quote: The road is better than the inn.
social.author: Miguel de Cervantes

social.quote: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.
social.author: Bob Marley

social.quote: Truth is superior to man s wisdom.
social.author: Mahatma Gandhi

social.quote: If you don't want to slip up tomorrow, speak the truth today.
social.author: Bruce Lee

social.quote: Every truth passes through three stages before it is recognized. In the first it is ridiculed, in the second it is opposed, in the third it is regarded as self-evident.
social.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

social.quote: Jokes? There are no jokes. The truth is the funniest joke of all.
social.author: Muhammad Ali

social.quote: ... the desire for truth must take precedence over all other desires.
social.author: Albert Einstein

social.quote: They who know truth in truth, and untruth in untruth, arrive at truth, and follow true desires.
social.author: Dhammapada

social.quote: Truth is such a rare thing, it is delightful to tell it.
social.author: Emily Dickinson

social.quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself, you cannot tell it about other people.
social.author: Virginia Woolf

social.quote: Every moment of my life I realize that God is putting me on my trial.
social.author: Mahatma Gandhi

social.quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
social.author: Confucius

social.quote: When God wants to make a man, he puts him into some storm.
social.author: Lettie Cowman

social.quote: Thank you Lord that this has a purpose. You're going to teach me something of your greatness in this that I would never have known otherwise.
social.author: Sandy Edmonson

social.quote: ... Not only are we comforted in our trials, but our trials can equip us to comfort others.
social.author: Billy Graham

social.quote: As sure as ever God puts His children in the furnace, He will be in the furnace with them.
social.author: Charles H. Spurgeon

social.quote: Trials teach us what we are.
social.author: Charles H. Spurgeon

social.quote: Nature has left this tincture in the blood, That all men would be tyrants if they could.
social.author: Daniel Defoe

social.quote: Though oppression may give rise to violent and repeated outbreaks, like the convulsions of a man in pain, it cannot mature a settled purpose and plan of regeneration, unless a new notion of happiness is joined to the sense of present evil.
social.author: Lord Acton

social.quote: Death is a softer thing by far than tyranny.
social.author: Aeschylus

social.quote: This is a sickness rooted and inherent in the nature of a tyranny: that he that holds it does not trust his friends.
social.author: Aeschylus

social.quote: Any excuse will serve a tyrant.
social.author: Aesop

social.quote: It is in fact far easier to act under conditions of tyranny than it is to think.
social.author: Hannah Arendt

social.quote: Make men large and strong, and tyranny will bankrupt itself in making shackles for them.
social.author: Henry Ward Beecher

social.quote: The slave begins by demanding justice and ends by wanting to wear a crown. He must dominate in his turn.
social.author: Albert Camus

social.quote: The laws can't be enforced against the man who is the laws' master.
social.author: Benvenuto Cellini

social.quote: When a nation has allowed itself to fall under a tyrannical regime, it cannot be absolved from the faults due to the guilt of that regime.
social.author: Winston Churchill

social.quote: A tyrant does not remain in the world; But the curse on him abides forever!
social.author: Sadi of Shiraz

social.quote: The most horrible thing is not a government that stages public executions, but a government that secretly disposes of its victims.
social.author: Lu Xun

social.quote: The more complete the despotism, the more smoothly all things move on the surface.
social.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

social.quote: You cannot run faster than a bullet.
social.author: Idi Amin

social.quote: If when I die, I am still a dictator, I will certainly go down into the oblivion of all dictators. If, on the other hand, I succeed in establishing a truly stable foundation for a democratic government, I will live forever in every home in China.
social.author: Chiang Kai-shek

social.quote: They who study mankind with a whip in their hands will always go wrong.
social.author: Frederick Douglass

social.quote: When you stop a dictator, there are always risks. But there are greater risks in not stopping a dictator.
social.author: Margaret Thatcher

social.quote: As the evening twilight fades away, the sky is filled with stars invisible by day.
social.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

social.quote: Suspicions amongst thoughts are like bats amongst birds, they ever fly by twilight.
social.author: Francis Bacon

social.quote: It is in this unearthly first hour of spring twilight that earth's almost agonized livingness is most felt. This hour is so dreadful to some people that they hurry indoors and turn on the lights.
social.author: Elizabeth Bowen

social.quote: As only New Yorkers know, if you can get through the twilight, you'll live through the night.
social.author: Dorothy Parker

social.quote: A Hair perhaps divides the False and True.
social.author: Omar Khayyam

social.quote: Lies are the religion of slaves and bosses. Truth is the god of the free man.
social.author: Maxim Gorky

social.quote: Truth exists. Only lies are invented.
social.author: Georges Braque

social.quote: It is only a good, sound, truthful person who can lie to any good purpose; if a man is not habitually truthful his very lies will be false to him and betray him.
social.author: Samuel Butler

social.quote: Would that I could discover truth as easily as I can uncover falsehood.
social.author: Cicero

social.quote: Though truth and falsehood be Near twins, yet truth a little elder is.
social.author: John Donne

social.quote: If a man fasten his attention on a single aspect of truth and apply himself to that alone for a long time, the truth becomes distorted and not itself but falsehood.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Irrationally held truths may be more harmful than reasoned errors.
social.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

social.quote: It is error alone which needs the support of government. Truth can stand by itself.
social.author: Thomas Jefferson

social.quote: Truth does not do as much good in the world as its imitations do harm.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: Treason doth never prosper: what's the reason? For if it prosper, none dare call it treason.
social.author: Sir John Harington

social.quote: The treason pleases, but the traitors are odious.
social.author: Miguel de Cervantes

social.quote: Bypasses are devices that allow some people to dash from point A to point B very fast while other people dash from point B to point A very fast.
social.author: Douglas Adams

social.quote: It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression "as pretty as an airport."
social.author: Douglas Adams

social.quote: God Almighty Himself must have been hilarious when human beings so mingled iron and water and fire as to make a railroad train!
social.author: Kurt Vonnegut

social.quote: Tell me how it is that in this room there are three candles and but one light, and I will explain to you the mode of the divine existence.
social.author: John Wesley

social.quote: The fin is coming early this siecle.
social.author: Angela Carter

social.quote: It is easy enough to praise men for the courage of their convictions. I wish I could teach the sad young of this mealy generation the courage of their confusions.
social.author: John Ciardi

social.quote: It takes a kind of shabby arrogance to survive in our time, and a fairly romantic nature to want to.
social.author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

social.quote: In a contrary and perhaps cruel way the twentieth century has relieved us of labor without at the same time relieving us of the conviction that only labor is meaningful.
social.author: Walter Kerr

social.quote: The trouble with our age is that it is all signpost and no destination.
social.author: Louis Kronenbergerer

social.quote: Modern man-whether in the womb of the masses, or with his workmates, or with his family, or alone-can never for one moment forget that he is living in a world in which he is a means and whose end is not his business.
social.author: Alberto Moravia

social.quote: We have created an industrial order geared to automatism, where feeble-mindedness, native or acquired, is necessary for docile productivity in the factory; and where a pervasive neurosis is the final gift of the meaningless life that issues forth at the other end.
social.author: Lewis Mumford

social.quote: Whoever has not felt the danger of our times palpitating under his hand, has not really penetrated to the vitals of destiny, he has merely pricked its surface.
social.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

social.quote: The atom bombs are piling up in the factories, the police are prowling through the cities, the lies are streaming from the loudspeakers, but the earth is still going round the sun.
social.author: George Orwell

social.quote: In these times you have to be an optimist to open your eyes when you awake in the morning.
social.author: Carl Sandburg

social.quote: If you tell the truth you don't have to remember anything.
social.author: Mark Twain

social.quote: It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless of course you are an exceptionally good liar.
social.author: Jerome K. Jerome

social.quote: I love you and, because I love you, I would sooner have you hate me for telling you the truth than adore me for telling you lies.
social.author: Pietro Aretino

social.quote: The highest compact we can make with our fellow is, "Let there be truth between us two for evermore"
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: Whatever games are played with us, we must play no games with ourselves, but deal in our privacy with the last honesty and truth.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: All truth is not to be told at all times.
social.author: Thomas Fuller

social.quote: He that does not speak truth to me does not believe me when I speak truth.
social.author: Thomas Fuller

social.quote: To be wiser than other men is to be honester than they; and strength of mind is only courage to see and speak the truth.
social.author: William Hazlitt

social.quote: Dare to be true: nothing can need a lie; A fault which needs it most, grows two thereby.
social.author: George Herbert

social.quote: Veracity is the heart of morality.
social.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

social.quote: Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
social.author: Rabindranath Tagore

social.quote: If I thought the world were to end tomorrow, I would still plant an apple tree today.
social.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

social.quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
social.author: Willa Cather

social.quote: No town can fail of beauty, though its walks were gutters and its houses hovels, if venerable trees make magnificent colonnades along its streets.
social.author: Henry Ward Beecher

social.quote: A woodland in full color is awesome as a forest fire, in magnitude at least; but a single tree is like a dancing tongue of flame to warm the heart.
social.author: Hal Borland

social.quote: We recently had a referendum in New York about extending the forest preserve. The city voted for it by a large majority; yet as I walk the streets I do not see afforestation written with conviction on the harried faces of my fellow citizens.
social.author: Learned Hand

social.quote: Trees are the earths endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
social.author: Rabindranath Tagore

social.quote: Any fine morning a power saw can fell a tree that took a thousand years to grow.
social.author: Edwin Way Teale

social.quote: Us sing and dance, make faces and give flower bouquets, trying to be loved. You ever notice that trees do everything to git attention we do, except walk?
social.author: Alice Walker

social.quote: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.
social.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

social.quote: Except during the nine months before he draws his first breath, no man manages his affairs as well as a tree does.
social.author: George Bernard Shaw

social.quote: A forest is in an acorn.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: The boughs that bear the most hang lowest.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: The tree is no sooner down than everyone runs for his hatchet.
social.author: Anonymous

social.quote: The groves were God's first temples.
social.author: William Cullen Bryant

social.quote: Large streams from little fountains flow, Tall oaks from little acorns grow.
social.author: David Everett

social.quote: He that plants trees loves others besides himself.
social.author: Thomas Fuller

social.quote: It would be as silly as to carry sticks into the forest.
social.author: Horace

social.quote: I think that I shall never see A poem as lovely as a tree.
social.author: Joyce Kilmer

social.quote: You believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself.
social.author: Marilyn Monroe

social.quote: Love all, trust a few.
social.author: William Shakespeare

social.quote: I know God will not give me anything I can't handle. I just wish that He didn't trust me so much.
social.author: Mother Teresa

social.quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly, and they will show themselves great.
social.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

social.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you do not trust enough.
social.author: Frank Crane

social.quote: To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved.
social.author: George Macdonald

social.quote: Never trust anybody who says, 'Trust me.' Except just this once, of course.
social.author: John Varley

social.quote: Love all, trust a few, Do wrong to none ...
social.author: William Shakespeare

social.quote: To be trusted is a far greater compliment than to be loved.
social.author: Ramsay MacDonald

social.quote: My favorite quote is by Seneca: 'It goes a long way towards making someone trustworthy if you trust them.'
social.author: Clive Stafford Smith

social.quote: Little things seem nothing, but they give peace, like those meadow flowers which individually seem odorless but all together perfume the air.
social.author: Georges Bernanos

social.quote: The displacement of a little sand can change occasionally the course of deep rivers.
social.author: Manuel Gonzalez Prada

social.quote: Those who apply themselves too much to little things usually become incapable of great ones.
social.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

social.quote: It's the people whore comfortable who have time to worry over little trivial things.
social.author: William McFee

social.quote: Trifles make the sum of human things, And half our misery from our foibles springs.
social.author: Hannah More

social.quote: A toothache will cost a battle, a drizzle cancel an insurrection.
social.author: Vladimir Nabokov

social.quote: For the person for whom small things do not exist, the great is not great.
social.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

social.quote: A mere trifle consoles us, for a mere trifle distresses us.
social.author: Blaise Pascal

social.quote: What dire offence from amorous causes springs! What mighty contests rise from trivial things!
social.author: Alexander Pope

social.quote: Trifles make up the happiness or the misery of human life.
social.author: Alexander Smith

social.quote: Nothing lasts for ever - not even your troubles.
social.author: Arnold Glasgow

social.quote: There are three intolerable things in life - cold coffee, lukewarm champagne, and overexcited women.
